ranked_diseases.explanation: Nearly perfect phenotypic match with Case 1, sharing 26 out of 26 features including distinctive skeletal abnormalities (beaking of vertebral bodies, platyspondyly, short metacarpals/metatarsals), intellectual disability with absent speech, coarse facial features, and characteristic gait abnormalities.

Allelic disorder to Dyggve-Melchior-Clausen disease with similar skeletal features (platyspondyly, beaking of vertebral bodies) but typically without intellectual disability. However, some cases may have mild cognitive involvement.

Similar skeletal dysplasia phenotype to SMC1 with platyspondyly and vertebral abnormalities, but caused by mutations in a different gene (RAB33B). Less likely due to presence of intellectual disability.
Shares skeletal features including platyspondyly, scoliosis, and genu valgum, but lacks the characteristic beaking of vertebral bodies and intellectual disability typical of this patient.

Features platyspondyly, short neck, waddling gait, and genu valgum, but typically presents with corneal clouding, cardiac involvement, and less severe intellectual disability than observed in this patient.
Shares platyspondyly and short stature features, but lacks the severe intellectual disability, coarse facial features, and specific pattern of skeletal abnormalities seen in this patient.
